lines.text:
[Christine sees a casket in the room]
That is where I sleep. It keeps me reminded of that other dreamless sleep that cures all ills - forever!
You - You are the Phantom!
If I am the Phantom, it is because man's hatred has made me so. If I shall be saved, it will be because your love redeems me.

[title card]
She is singing to bring down the chandelier!

His eyes are ghastly beads in which there is no light - like holes in a grinning skull! His face is like leprous parchment, yellow skin strung tight over protruding bones! His nose - there is no nose!
[title card]
[at the Bal Masque as "The Red Death"]
Beneath your dancing feet are the tombs of tortured men! Thus does The Red Death rebuke your merriment!
[title card]
[after having drowned Raoul's brother]
The callers have departed.

[title card]
Feast your eyes! Glut your soul on my accursed ugliness!

[title card]
Christine, tonight I placed the world at your feet!

[title card]
Did you hear voices?
[Christine shakes her head]

[title card]
Perhaps we have more callers.
Heat - Intolerable heat!

[title card]
If you turn the Scorpion - you have said 'Yes' and spared de Chagny. Turn the grasshopper - - and the Opera House is blown to a thousand bits!

[title card]
What do you offer for their lives? Your answer quick - they can survive but a few moments!

[title card]
She has betrayed me!
If you love me as you say you do you, will let me go? I promise to be your slave forever.
Sanctuary of song lovers, The Paris Opera House, rising nobly over medieval torture chambers, hidden dungeons, long forgotten.

[to new Opera House Owners]
It is barely possible you may hear of a ghost, a Phantom of the Opera!

[to Christine]
I have brought you here - five cellars underground - because I love you! For long weary months I have awaited this hour! So that which is good within me, aroused by your purity, might plead for your love.
Men once knew me as Erik, but for many years I have lived in these cellars, a nameless legend.
You are in no peril as long as you do not touch my mask.
Since first I saw your face, this music has been singing to me of you and of - love triumphant! Yet listen - there sounds an ominous undercurrent of warning!
No longer like a toad in these foul cellars will I secrete the venom of hatred - for you shall bring me love!
